meanings.definition: A retaining wall or facing of masonry or other material, supporting or protecting a rampart, wall, etc.
meanings.sent1: The revetment along the riverbank prevented erosion.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers built a sturdy revetment to shield themselves from enemy fire.
meanings.sent3: The revetment looked like a giant puzzle piece holding the fort together.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a revetment against the storm of his anger.
meanings.sent5: The revetment stood tall, a guardian of the ancient castle.
